Posts.Content: On 1/31/2007 Judy1957 wrote: I was diagnosed about 3 weeks ago with DCIS.  It is in beginning stages of being invasive but doesn't seem to be in the lymph nodes yet.  My family has a history of breast cancer and my surgeon is in agreement that a bilateral will probably be a good choice as this is probably genetic.  I would appreciate input from those of you who have had the bilateral done, does it feel like it was the wrong decision and what are your thoughts on reconstruction.  My surgery is scheduled for the 13th of Feb. I was diagnosed on July 5, 2006.  I chose to have a double on July 21,2006 because I knew I could never face this again.  I was not able to do my reconstruction at the same time because my plastic surgeon was on vacation and I just wanted the cancer under control and decided not to wait even a week.  I am glad because this has given me time to research and decide which way I want to go.  I have also gained about 20 pounds and would like to not have this when I have my next surgery.  I walk at least a mile a day on the treadmill and try to watch what I eat, I have 3 more taxol treatments and then I will start harmone therapy and will continue with herceptin.  For me personally, waiting has been right.  I have had so much time to think and adjust.  I will answer any questions you have and will pray for you.  Good Luck

Posts.Content: On 2/2/2007 Janie Rocks wrote:   On 2/2/2007 Pcola2006 wrote:   On 1/31/2007 Judy1957 wrote: I was diagnosed about 3 weeks ago with DCIS.  It is in beginning stages of being invasive but doesn't seem to be in the lymph nodes yet.  My family has a history of breast cancer and my surgeon is in agreement that a bilateral will probably be a good choice as this is probably genetic.  I would appreciate input from those of you who have had the bilateral done, does it feel like it was the wrong decision and what are your thoughts on reconstruction.  My surgery is scheduled for the 13th of Feb. I was diagnosed on July 5, 2006.  I chose to have a double on July 21,2006 because I knew I could never face this again.  I was not able to do my reconstruction at the same time because my plastic surgeon was on vacation and I just wanted the cancer under control and decided not to wait even a week.  I am glad because this has given me time to research and decide which way I want to go.  I have also gained about 20 pounds and would like to not have this when I have my next surgery.  I walk at least a mile a day on the treadmill and try to watch what I eat, I have 3 more taxol treatments and then I will start harmone therapy and will continue with herceptin.  For me personally, waiting has been right.  I have had so much time to think and adjust.  I will answer any questions you have and will pray for you.  Good Luck  Hello;  I had a bilateral almost 8 years ago by choice and reconstruction immediately.  I 've never been sorry about the decision to go bi-lateral, only about the choice to have reconstruction at the same time.   If I had it to do over again I would wait and do more research on which way to go. I think it is a wise decision to take both breasts, especially with your history.  It isn't that hard to get over having both removed and I think you wil be happy not to have the stress and worry about finding cancer in the breast that is left if you don't have both removed.  I wish you the best outcome possible and feel free to respond or ask any questions you might have. My name is Janie and I live in Illinois.   Hi Janie, My name is Jackie and I live in Florida.  I am meeting with my doctor in March to discuss the reconstruction.  I can't wait to finish taking Taxol in 3 weeks so that maybe I can get rid of some fluid.  Did you take Herceptin?  I will be taking it every 3 weeks maybe up to a year.  I also elected to remove both.  It really wasn't a hard decision for me.  I knew I couldn't live day to day thinking it would return in the other breast.  I have no regrets.  I am thinking about having Tram Flap.  I don't think I want to have any foreign substances in my body.  Let me know if you have any ideas about this type.  Thanks, Jackie
